alert.note: Alert for Adair; Cherokee; Delaware; Haskell; Le Flore; Sequoyah (Oklahoma) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued October 24 at 2:44PM CDT by NWS Tulsa
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of Benton, western Crawford, northwestern Sebastian, western Washington, southeastern Delaware, eastern Haskell, Sequoyah, Adair, northern Le Flore and southeastern Cherokee Counties through 330 PM CDT... At 243 PM CDT, Doppler radar indicated strong showers with embedded thunderstorms along a line extending from 3 miles north of South West City to 4 miles east of Colcord to near Vian. Movement was east at 25 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down small tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations in or near the path include... Fort Smith... Fayetteville... Springdale... Rogers... Bentonville... Van Buren... Siloam Springs... Sallisaw... Stilwell... Stigler... Cedarville... Natural Dam... Bella Vista... Lowell... Farmington... Pea Ridge... Prairie Grove... Pocola... Muldrow... Roland... This includes the following highways, Interstate 40 in Arkansas between mile markers 0 and 5. Interstate 40 in Oklahoma between mile markers 293 and 328. Interstate 540 between mile markers 4 and 14. Interstate 49 between mile markers 56 and 93. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.

area.areaDesc: Adair; Cherokee; Delaware; Haskell; Le Flore; Sequoyah
